intro: Taverniera sericophylla, commonly known as the silky-leaf taverniera, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, velvety, and leathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with a strong, sometimes unpleasant odor. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
